title: Mounting a local directory onto itself leads to a hard hang
body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I created a remote with the name OneDrive, and then I used the wrong command to mount it to a directory with the same name:

`rclone mount OneDrive OneDrive`

(The correct command `rclone mount OneDrive: OneDrive` does work)

This led to rclone hanging very hard, not even a `sudo killall -9 rclone` will kill it. 

The mount shows up as ```
local:/home/emil/Skrivbord/Emils/OneDrive on /home/emil/Skrivbord/Emils/OneDrive type fuse.rclone (rw,nosuid,nodev,relatime,user_id=1000,group_id=1000)
``` and there seems to be no way of getting rid of it apart from rebooting (I tried `fusermount -u OneDrive` and `sudo umount OneDrive`, both fail with "Device or resource busy").

I know I used the wrong syntax, but it would be nice if rclone would detect a circular mount and prevent it from happening rather than locking up. :)

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.45
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.11.2
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Ubuntu 18.04, 64 bit

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

OneDrive (but in fact local file system is being used in this case)

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone mount OneDrive OneDrive`
`ls OneDrive`
